title:
Phonon-induced modification of polaritonic Rabi oscillations in the
  presence of the dark excitonic condensate
authors: Adham Alkady, Victor Fleurov, Anatoly Kuklov
abstract:
Optically inactive (dark) excitons are characterized by relatively long life
time, and therefore are desirable candidates for realizing collective excitonic
phases. However, a detection of their coherence by light is problematic. Here
we propose a method for detecting a dark excitonic condensate. It relies on the
interaction between excitons and phonons responsible for the interconversion
between bright and dark excitons. As long as the dark condensate forms, the
Rabi oscillations between photons and bright excitons can become strongly
modified. The analysis is conducted in the limit of weak interaction, and the
perspective for the case of the strong interaction leading to the polaronic
effect is discussed.
